reviewText: If you collect. oldtime cartoons, this DVD is a good one.

Dubs on this PC TREASURES collection are "best available source" and can vary from very good to only fair. Colors aren't as vibrant as in studio released animation, yet for the price this is a worthwhile set. Collection highlights: A silent Katzenjammer Kids short that's animated by Gregory LaCava. In the 1930s, he directed STAGE DOOR and MY MAN GODFREY. An early Walter Lantz toon featuring Oswald Rabbit. A Mutt & Jeff silent. Heckle & Jeckle's debut. A rare COLUMBIA Pictures Krazy Kat short. Studios represented: COLUMBIA [col], FAMOUS [fa], FLEISCHER [fl], INTERNATIONAL FILM SERVICE [ifs], JEFFERSON [je], LANTZ [la] PROGRAM-- LITTLE SWEE' PEA (1936) [fl] - A trip to the zoo keeps Popeye busy rescuing a mischievous baby from the animals. THE TALKING MAGPIES (1947) [tt] - Heckle 'n Jeckle nest near a farmer's bedroom window and disturb the old man's sleep. A BOUT WITH A TROUT (1947) [fa] - Little Lulu plays hookey and goes fishing. Dream sequence includes the song "Swinging on a Star." BUTTERSCOTCH AND SODA (1948) [fa] - Little Audrey's sugar withdrawal includes hallucinations of a nightmarish Candy Land. THE MOUSE EXTERMINATOR (1940) [col] - The final COLUMBIA Krazy Kat short. (Krazy sounds like Jack Benny's Rochester.) SLICK SLEUTHS (silent-1926) [je] - Mutt and Jeff are deerstalker hat-wearing detectives in search of "The Phantom." THERE'S GOOD BOOS TO-NIGHT (1948) [fa] - Casper the Ghost makes friends with a little fox that's later killed by hunters. POLICY AND PIE (silent-1918) [ifs] - The Kids put toads inside a mushroom pie that Mama makes for Captain after he gets a life insurance policy. PEST PUPIL (1957) [fa] - A well meaning tutor struggles to educate Baby Huey. BEACH COMBERS (1936) [la] - While Oswald Rabbit fishes, ducklings launch his picnic basket and sink to the sea bottom with it.
